step_by_step_thinking: The patient presents with acute esophageal variceal bleeding, likely due to cirrhosis from alcoholism. After acute management with octreotide and endoscopic intervention, secondary prevention is needed. Nonselective beta-blockers (NSBBs) like nadolol are indicated to reduce portal pressure and prevent rebleeding, as per documents [0][1][2][6], and [11]. Other options (alpha-blockers, calcium channel blockers) are not indicated for this purpose. Nadolol (D) is a NSBB and fits the criteria.
